14#ifndef NS_INTERFACEMGR_H
15#define NS_INTERFACEMGR_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file
22 * \brief
23 * The interface manager monitors the operating system's list
24 * of network interfaces, creating and destroying listeners
25 * as needed.
26 *
27 * Reliability:
28 *\li No impact expected.
29 *
30 * Resources:
31 *
32 * Security:
33 * \li The server will only be able to bind to the DNS port on
34 * newly discovered interfaces if it is running as root.
35 *
36 * Standards:
37 *\li The API for scanning varies greatly among operating systems.
38 * This module attempts to hide the differences.
39 */
40
41/***
42 *** Imports
43 ***/
44
45#include <stdbool.h>
46
47#include <isc/magic.h>
48#include <isc/mem.h>
49#include <isc/socket.h>
50
51#include <dns/geoip.h>
52#include <dns/result.h>
53
54#include <ns/listenlist.h>
55#include <ns/types.h>
56
57/***
58 *** Types
59 ***/
60
61#define IFACE_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('I',':','-',')')
62#define NS_INTERFACE_VALID(t) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(t, IFACE_MAGIC)
63
64#define NS_INTERFACEFLAG_ANYADDR 0x01U /*%< bound to "any" address */
65#define MAX_UDP_DISPATCH 128 /*%< Maximum number of UDP dispatchers
66 to start per interface */
67/*% The nameserver interface structure */
68struct ns_interface {
69 unsigned int magic; /*%< Magic number. */
70 ns_interfacemgr_t * mgr; /*%< Interface manager. */
71 isc_mutex_t lock;
72 int references; /*%< Locked */
73 unsigned int generation; /*%< Generation number. */
74 isc_sockaddr_t addr; /*%< Address and port. */
75 unsigned int flags; /*%< Interface characteristics */
76 char name[32]; /*%< Null terminated. */
77 dns_dispatch_t * udpdispatch[MAX_UDP_DISPATCH];
78 /*%< UDP dispatchers. */
79 isc_socket_t * tcpsocket; /*%< TCP socket. */
80 isc_dscp_t dscp; /*%< "listen-on" DSCP value */
81 atomic_uint_fast32_t ntcpaccepting; /*%< Number of clients
82 ready to accept new
83 TCP connections on this
84 interface */
85 atomic_uint_fast32_t ntcpactive; /*%< Number of clients
86 servicing TCP queries
87 (whether accepting or
88 connected) */
89 int nudpdispatch; /*%< Number of UDP dispatches */
90 ns_clientmgr_t * clientmgr; /*%< Client manager. */
91 ISC_LINK(ns_interface_t) link;
92};
93
94/***
95 *** Functions
96 ***/
97
98isc_result_t
99ns_interfacemgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx,
100 ns_server_t *sctx,
101 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr,
102 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr,
103 isc_socketmgr_t *socketmgr,
104 dns_dispatchmgr_t *dispatchmgr,
105 isc_task_t *task,
106 unsigned int udpdisp,
107 dns_geoip_databases_t *geoip,
108 ns_interfacemgr_t **mgrp);
109/*%<
110 * Create a new interface manager.
111 *
112 * Initially, the new manager will not listen on any interfaces.
113 * Call ns_interfacemgr_setlistenon() and/or ns_interfacemgr_setlistenon6()
114 * to set nonempty listen-on lists.
115 */
116
117void
118ns_interfacemgr_attach(ns_interfacemgr_t *source, ns_interfacemgr_t **target);
119
120void
121ns_interfacemgr_detach(ns_interfacemgr_t **targetp);
122
123void
124ns_interfacemgr_shutdown(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr);
125
126void
127ns_interfacemgr_setbacklog(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr, int backlog);
128/*%<
129 * Set the size of the listen() backlog queue.
130 */
131
132bool
133ns_interfacemgr_islistening(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr);
134/*%<
135 * Return if the manager is listening on any interface. It can be called
136 * after a scan or adjust.
137 */
138
139isc_result_t
140ns_interfacemgr_scan(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr, bool verbose);
141/*%<
142 * Scan the operatings system's list of network interfaces
143 * and create listeners when new interfaces are discovered.
144 * Shut down the sockets for interfaces that go away.
145 *
146 * This should be called once on server startup and then
147 * periodically according to the 'interface-interval' option
148 * in named.conf.
149 */
150
151isc_result_t
152ns_interfacemgr_adjust(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr, ns_listenlist_t *list,
153 bool verbose);
154/*%<
155 * Similar to ns_interfacemgr_scan(), but this function also tries to see the
156 * need for an explicit listen-on when a list element in 'list' is going to
157 * override an already-listening a wildcard interface.
158 *
159 * This function does not update localhost and localnets ACLs.
160 *
161 * This should be called once on server startup, after configuring views and
162 * zones.
163 */
164
165void
166ns_interfacemgr_setlistenon4(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr, ns_listenlist_t *value);
167/*%<
168 * Set the IPv4 "listen-on" list of 'mgr' to 'value'.
169 * The previous IPv4 listen-on list is freed.
170 */
171
172void
173ns_interfacemgr_setlistenon6(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr, ns_listenlist_t *value);
174/*%<
175 * Set the IPv6 "listen-on" list of 'mgr' to 'value'.
176 * The previous IPv6 listen-on list is freed.
177 */
178
179dns_aclenv_t *
180ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr);
181
182void
183ns_interface_attach(ns_interface_t *source, ns_interface_t **target);
184
185void
186ns_interface_detach(ns_interface_t **targetp);
187
188void
189ns_interface_shutdown(ns_interface_t *ifp);
190/*%<
191 * Stop listening for queries on interface 'ifp'.
192 * May safely be called multiple times.
193 */
194
195void
196ns_interfacemgr_dumprecursing(FILE *f, ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr);
197
198bool
199ns_interfacemgr_listeningon(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr, const isc_sockaddr_t *addr);
200
201ns_interface_t *
202ns__interfacemgr_getif(ns_interfacemgr_t *mgr);
203ns_interface_t *
204ns__interfacemgr_nextif(ns_interface_t *ifp);
205/*
206 * Functions to allow external callers to walk the interfaces list.
207 * (Not intended for use outside this module and associated tests.)
208 */
209#endif /* NS_INTERFACEMGR_H */
210
